column3:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.
This is used in some "hot loops", so making a benchmark to prove it is not significantly slowing down the function call would help.

I don't know if this helps:
```
$ cat exec.sh 
#!/bin/sh
./test/functional/mempool_limit.py && ./test/functional/mining_prioritisetransaction.py 
$ time ./exec.sh 
2019-01-29T22:22:07.529000Z TestFramework (INFO): Initializing test directory /tmp/bitcoin_func_test_vn7gv6oi
2019-01-29T22:22:07.814000Z TestFramework (INFO): Check that mempoolminfee is minrelytxfee
2019-01-29T22:22:08
utACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15282/commits/03f7a8f392c0f5574ca2dbc19e7a16d32dc97312\n\nExtremely minor slowdown imo for great increase in test clarity.
It seems like https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14691 is making this change obsolete. Not sure if that one will land, though.
@MarcoFalke given the benchmarks, are you ok with this ?

Sure but there is also [#14691](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/14691.html) (tests: Speedup feature_pruning test and refactor big transaction logic by @conscott) which look promising
@fanquake @MarcoFalke rebased. Up to you guys whether it's relevant, of course. I think it's an improvement.
You could take out everything from this hot loop except the `txtouts.append` line to see if we gain back that 0.18 secs?
Strangely enough this made it 0.2 seconds slower on my machine :/ So I think it's better as-is.
please don't let this block merging: I think you can use `FromHex(CTransaction(), rawtx)` here for a short one-liner
